solution_line_template: Cole has to pay {fencing_cost_per_foot} * {side_length} = $<<{fencing_cost_per_foot}*{side_length}={cost_one_side_fence}>>{cost_one_side_fence} for one side of the side fence.

For the shared left fence, he has to pay two-thirds of {cost_one_side_fence}, so he has to pay {cost_one_side_fence} * {left_neighbor_numerator} / {left_neighbor_denominator} = $<<{cost_one_side_fence}*{left_neighbor_numerator}/{left_neighbor_denominator}={cost_shared_left_fence}>>{cost_shared_left_fence}.
The shared back fence will cost {fencing_cost_per_foot} * {back_length} = $<<{fencing_cost_per_foot}*{back_length}={cost_full_back_fence}>>{cost_full_back_fence}.

He has to pay for half the back fence, so it will cost {cost_full_back_fence} / {back_fence_share_denominator} = $<<{cost_full_back_fence}/{back_fence_share_denominator}={cost_cole_back_fence}>>{cost_cole_back_fence}.

Thus, Cole has to pay {cost_shared_left_fence} + {cost_one_side_fence} + {cost_cole_back_fence} = $<<{cost_shared_left_fence}+{cost_one_side_fence}+{cost_cole_back_fence}={total_cost_cole}>>{total_cost_cole} for the fence.
